RMPDescription: OG 02; Revi 8/08; ER Coord rev 12/08; Contact 3/09

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The True Leaf Farms #2 facility (Yuma, Arizona) accidental release prevention policy involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. The True Leaf Farms #2 facility emergency response policy involves the preparation of the emergency response services available in the community. It is also in compliance with the EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.



The True Leaf Farms #2 facility in Yuma utilizes anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant in their portable and permit refrigeration operations. Fresh produce is brought from the fields and cooled to remove field heat. The produce is then stored in a cold storage warehouse. The facility holds 26,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia for the refrigeration process. 



The general accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:

?    Training of the operators. 

?    Preventative maintenance program. 

?    Use of state-of-the-art process and safety equipment. 

?    Use of accurate and effective operating procedures. 

?    Performance of a process hazard analysis of equipment and procedures. 

?    Implementation of an auditing and inspection program.

    

Chemical specific prevention steps including awareness of the hazardous and toxic properties of these toxic substances.



No RMP/PSM defined accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia have occurred at this facility in the past five years.



True Leaf Farms #2 will fully implement the RMP and will initiate appropriate changes as needed to maintain a safe operation.



The emergency response program includes an emergency response notification plan. Emergency response drills and drill evaluations are conducted once every year; emergency operations and response procedures are also reviewed at that time.
